reviewText: The third episode of this fourth season, BY DAWN'S EARLY LIGHT, was broadcasted on Oct. 27th, 1974. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Fourth Season. For his performance in this episode, Patrick McGoohan earned the 1975 Emmy award in the Outstanding Single Performance by a Supporting Actor category. After Columbo Collector's Edition: Negative Reaction, this is the second episode in a row in the fourth season that deserves our respect. We have to remember that this episode was shot just months after the end of the Vietnam war if we want to really understand why the duel between lt. Columbo and Col. Lyle C. Rumford was a mirror of the American society when the episode was aired. A VHS to keep in your library.

Another great Columbo episode - This one takes place at a military school. Patrick McGoohan stars as the strict commandant of the Haynes Military Academy. A young Bruno Kirby has a small role as a cadet. There is mystery on campus when a ceremonial cannon suddenly explodes causing a death.
